title: Andrew Bolt manages to get ‘under the skin’ of Chris Bowen
description: Sky News host Andrew Bolt says he’s managed to get “under the skin” of the Climate Change and Energy Minister Chris Bowen.  Mr Bolt said Chris Bowen is the “most dangerous and incompetent” minister in the Albanese government.  “I've offended him by telling the truth.  “He lies, like he did in complaining about me today in parliament as he mocked Dan Tehan, the Opposition's energy spokesman.”

title: Host ‘outraged’ at an international student’s speech on hating Australia
description: Sky News host Rowan Dean is astounded by an international university student's speech on how terrible Australia is.  “People should not be surprised, but they should be absolutely outraged,” Mr Dean told Sky News host Andrew Bolt.  “Our universities are cesspits of left-wing indoctrination.  “All we’re doing is exporting, selling places in very comfortable Australian cities to people who, in my opinion, do not deserve the benefits of this country.”

title: ‘Tears, pain and losses’: The fight for democracy in Belarus
description: Belarusian Opposition Leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya states all the people who “oppose and dictate” to the Belarusian government are “targets”.  “Sometimes you have to sacrifice your feelings of insecurity … to fight,” Ms Tsikhanouskaya told Sky News host Sharri Markson.  “This path is paved with tears, pain, and losses … but I took this responsibility.  “My task is to advocate for changes in Belarus.”

title: ‘Zero resolutions’: United Nations exposed for hypocrisy
description: U.N. Watch Executive Director Hillel Neuer exposes the United Nations' hypocrisy where there have been “zero resolutions” on Sudan and Nigeria.  “There's only a handful of countries in the world that the general assembly addresses … there were 10 resolutions on Iran, there were 10 resolutions on North Korea,” Mr Neuer told Sky News host Sharri Markson.  “174 resolutions condemning Israel.”

title: Megyn Kelly reflects on Charlie Kirk's ‘genuine’ reaction to Trump’s election win
description: ‘The Megyn Kelly Show’ Host Megyn Kelly reflects on the death of Charlie Kirk one year on since US President Donald Trump’s election win.  “He [Charlie Kirk] was so happy on that election night and his reaction was so genuine that it went totally viral,” Ms Kelly told Sky News host Paul Murray.   “Just tears in his eyes, glory be to God.  “If only he had known … some lunatic would take his life.”

title: ‘Radical socialist’ Zohran Mamdani will ‘ruin’ New York as mayor
description: Sky News host Freya Leach explains how New York City will stop being a “great city” following the election of “radical socialist” Zohran Mamdani.  “They [lefties] are also about to ruin New York, say goodbye to that once great city, because it is going to go downhill real fast.  “Radical democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani has been emphatically elected as the next mayor of New York.”

title: ‘Un-Australian’: Gai Waterhouse blasts anti-Melbourne Cup protesters
description: Sky News host James Macpherson talks about how Gai Waterhouse has blasted anti-Melbourne Cup protesters over animal cruelty claims.  “Every year now there is a ‘say nup to the cup’ counter event that’s held for those that believe that horse racing is cruelty to animals.  “Trainer Gai Waterhouse has come out today and really got stuck into those who protest against the cup, calling them un-Australian.”

title: Megyn Kelly reflects on Charlie Kirk's ‘genuine’ reaction to Trump’s election win
description: ‘The Megyn Kelly Show’ Host Megyn Kelly reflects on the death of Charlie Kirk one year on since US President Donald Trump’s election win.  “He [Charlie Kirk] was so happy on that election night and his reaction was so genuine that it went totally viral,” Ms Kelly told Sky News host Paul Murray.   “Just tears in his eyes, glory be to God.  “If only he had known … some lunatic would take his life.”

title: Zohran Mamdani’s economic policies labelled ‘disastrous’ for New York City
description: New York Post Columnist Miranda Devine dissects the economic policies that Zohran Mamdani will implement in New York City.  “Not having any sort of cynicism about the ability of any of these big promise politicians to actually deliver,” Ms Devine told Sky News host Sharri Markson.  “For how long in Australia have we heard about universal childcare, this is now Mamdani’s big gift.”

title: Mamdani’s victory shows how young New Yorkers felt ‘cheated’ by Democratic establishment
description: New York Post Columnist Miranda Devine breaks down how Zohran Mamdani won the New York City mayoral election.  “It’s a very Democrat city, and the sort of anti-Mamdani vote was split almost evenly 50-50,” Ms Devine told Sky News host Sharri Markson.  “It’s a very divided city … the other problem is that you have a lot of young people in this city, it’s very expensive … they feel cheated by the establishment.”

title: ‘A good shake-up’: ASIO’s Mike Burgess warns of extremism in Australia
description: Former Australian Federal Police detective superintendent David Craig comments on ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess' warning for Australia’s national security.  “It’s a good awakening, a good shake-up for the Australian population, and I hope they listen to Burgess,” Mr Craig told Sky News host Peta Credlin.  “I think it’s a very important tactical way to inform the Australian community of the threats that we face, because they are, as Burgess says, unprecedented.”

title: Former politician’s new book on ‘secret’ deals between government and First Nations people
description: Former Victorian Liberal MP Roger Pescott discusses the treaty bill between the Victorian Government and First Nations people.   “The reason was very simple, I had noticed that there was lots and lots of activity between the government and Aboriginal groups which was very, very secret,” Mr Pescott told Sky News host Andrew Bolt.  “All those agreements all point in one direction, that is giving the Aboriginal people more than their fair share of the assets .”

title: Labor under fire as Australian government debt nears $1 trillion
description: Sky News host Paul Murray discusses how Australia’s debt is nudging toward the $1 trillion mark.  “Once we head ten years later down the track, it might be a lot higher than a trillion,” Mr Murray said.  “According to these predictions, we’re going to end up on the best part of at least $2 trillion … this government thinks that they … will never lose again.”

title: ‘Like two hyenas’: Megyn Kelly mocks Meghan Markle’s inauthentic video
description: ‘The Megyn Kelly Show’ Host Megyn Kelly criticises Meghan Markle for an unauthentic video of herself watching the LA Dodgers.  “Meghan Markle has no affinity for the LA Dodgers,” Ms Kelly told Sky News host Paul Murray.  “They sat in that theatre like two hyenas… who laughs like that?  “She's desperate for our attention.”

title: Donald Trump threatens military action over Christian massacres in Nigeria
description: Former US ambassador for international religious freedom Sam Brownback speculates on whether US President Donald Trump will initiate military action in Nigeria to address the killing of Christians in the country.   “The government should clearly be doing a lot more to protect the nation.  “President Trump met with the then-President of Nigeria in his first term, and he said: ‘Hey, you've got to stop the killing of Christians there,’ and the president went back, sent his military out to the region, and the death numbers fell.  “They can do it; they haven’t done it – they haven’t been willing to.  “What you’re seeing now, President Trump do, is to put pressure on, address this … my concern is you’re going to see a military coup takeover in Nigeria.”
